title: Helper trait hack const generics ICE

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
In https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/60466#discussion_r282368369, @rodrimati1992 shared a snippet to implement a trait only for numbers > 0. After a few modifications done by me, it gives you an ICE ([playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=83b93a779eb7788a2c2aa73b7b8e2563)):

```rust
#![feature(const_generics)] 

trait Foo {
    fn foo() -> Self;
}
impl<T, const N: usize> Foo for [T; N] 
where 
    Self:FooImpl<{N==0}>
{
    fn foo()->Self{
        Self::default_impl()
    }
}

trait FooImpl<const IS_ZERO:bool>{
    fn default_impl()->Self;
}

impl<T> FooImpl<{0u8==0u8}> for [T;0] {
    fn default_impl()->Self{
        []
    }
}

impl<T,const N:usize> FooImpl<{0u8!=0u8}> for [T;N] 
where
    T:Default,
{
    fn default_impl()->Self{
        [T::default(); N]
    }
}
```

<details> <summary>Compiler error message</summary>

```
error: internal compiler error: unexpected const parent in type_of_def_id(): TraitRef(TraitRef { path: path(FooImpl<>), hir_ref_id: HirId { owner: DefIndex(23), local_id: 10 } })

  --> src/main.rs:19:17
   |

  --> src/main.rs:25:31

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'no errors encountered even though `delay_span_bug` issued', src/librustc_errors/lib.rs:356:17
note: Run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace.

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.37.0-nightly (37d001e4d 2019-05-29) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: compiler flags: -C codegen-units=1 -C debuginfo=2 --crate-type bin

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

error: Could not compile `playground`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```
